theme:check.description: Calls and runs [Theme Check](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/theme-check) to analyze your theme code for errors and to ensure that it follows theme and Liquid best practices. [Learn more about the checks that Theme Check runs.](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/theme-check/checks)

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

dev-preview.name: dev-preview
dev-preview.description:
Use the dev preview version of theme check
Applies the typescript implementation of theme check to the theme

path.name: path
path.description: The path to your theme directory.

category.name: category
category.description:
Only run this category of checks
Runs checks matching all categories when specified more than once

config.name: config
config.description:
Use the config provided, overriding .theme-check.yml if present
      Supports all theme-check: config values, e.g., theme-check:theme-app-extension,
      theme-check:recommended, theme-check:all
      For backwards compatibility, :theme_app_extension is also supported

exclude-category.name: exclude-category
exclude-category.description:
Exclude this category of checks
Excludes checks matching any category when specified more than once

fail-level.name: fail-level
fail-level.description: Minimum severity for exit with error code

update-docs.name: update-docs
update-docs.description: Update Theme Check docs (objects, filters, and tags)

environment.name: environment
environment.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

theme:console.description:
Starts the Shopify Liquid REPL (read-eval-print loop) tool. This tool provides an interactive terminal interface for evaluating Liquid code and exploring Liquid objects, filters, and tags using real store data.

  You can also provide context to the console using a URL, as some Liquid objects are context-specific
theme:console.usage:
shopify theme console

  shopify theme console --url /products/classic-leather-jacket

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

store.name: store
store.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

password.name: password
password.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

environment.name: environment
environment.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

url.name: url
url.description: The url to be used as context

port.name: port
port.description: Local port to serve authentication service.

theme:delete.summary: Delete remote themes from the connected store. This command can't be undone.
theme:delete.description:
Deletes a theme from your store.

  You can specify multiple themes by ID. If no theme is specified, then you're prompted to select the theme that you want to delete from the list of themes in your store.

  You're asked to confirm that you want to delete the specified themes before they are deleted. You can skip this confirmation using the `--force` flag.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

password.name: password
password.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

show-all.name: show-all
show-all.description: Include others development themes in theme list.

theme.name: theme
theme.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

store.name: store
store.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

environment.name: environment
environment.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

theme:dev.summary: Uploads the current theme as a development theme to the connected store, then prints theme editor and preview URLs to your terminal. While running, changes will push to the store in real time.
theme:dev.description:
Uploads the current theme as the specified theme, or a [development theme](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#development-themes), to a store so you can preview it.

This command returns the following information:

- A link to your development theme at http://127.0.0.1:9292. This URL can hot reload local changes to CSS and sections, or refresh the entire page when a file changes, enabling you to preview changes in real time using the store's data.

  You can specify a different network interface and port using `--host` and `--port`.

- A link to the [editor](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/online-editor) for the theme in the Shopify admin.

- A [preview link](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/themes/adding-themes?shpxid=cee12a89-AA22-4AD3-38C8-91C8FC0E1FB0#share-a-theme-preview-with-others) that you can share with other developers.

If you already have a development theme for your current environment, then this command replaces the development theme with your local theme. You can override this using the `--theme-editor-sync` flag.

> Note: You can't preview checkout customizations using http://127.0.0.1:9292.

Development themes are deleted when you run `shopify auth logout`. If you need a preview link that can be used after you log out, then you should [share](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli/commands#share) your theme or [push](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli/commands#push) to an unpublished theme on your store.

You can run this command only in a directory that matches the [default Shopify theme folder structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#directory-structure).

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

path.name: path
path.description: The path to your theme directory.

host.name: host
host.description: Set which network interface the web server listens on. The default value is 127.0.0.1.

live-reload.name: live-reload
live-reload.description:
The live reload mode switches the server behavior when a file is modified:
- hot-reload Hot reloads local changes to CSS and sections (default)
- full-page  Always refreshes the entire page
- off        Deactivate live reload

poll.name: poll
poll.description: Force polling to detect file changes.

theme-editor-sync.name: theme-editor-sync
theme-editor-sync.description: Synchronize Theme Editor updates in the local theme files.

port.description: Local port to serve theme preview from.

store.name: store
store.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

theme.name: theme
theme.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

nodelete.name: nodelete
nodelete.description: Runs the dev command without deleting local files.

only.name: only
only.description: Hot reload only files that match the specified pattern.

ignore.name: ignore
ignore.description: Skip hot reloading any files that match the specified pattern.

stable.name: stable
stable.description: Performs the upload by relying in the legacy upload approach (slower, but it might be more stable in some scenarios)

force.name: force
force.description: Proceed without confirmation, if current directory does not seem to be theme directory.

password.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

environment.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

notify.description: The file path or URL. The file path is to a file that you want updated on idle. The URL path is where you want a webhook posted to report on file changes.

open.name: open
open.description: Automatically launch the theme preview in your default web browser.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

command.description: The command for which to show CLI2 help.

theme:info.description: Displays information about your theme environment, including your current store.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

theme:init.summary: Clones a Git repository to use as a starting point for building a new theme.
theme:init.description:
Clones a Git repository to your local machine to use as the starting point for building a theme.

  If no Git repository is specified, then this command creates a copy of [Dawn](https://github.com/Shopify/dawn), Shopify's example theme, with the specified name in the current folder. If no name is provided, then you're prompted to enter one.

  > Caution: If you're building a theme for the Shopify Theme Store, then you can use Dawn as a starting point. However, the theme that you submit needs to be [substantively different from Dawn](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/store/requirements#uniqueness) so that it provides added value for users. Learn about the [ways that you can use Dawn](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/dawn#ways-to-use-dawn).

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

path.name: path
path.description: The path to your theme directory.

clone-url.name: clone-url
clone-url.description: The Git URL to clone from. Defaults to Shopify's example theme, Dawn: https://github.com/Shopify/dawn.git

latest.name: latest
latest.description: Downloads the latest release of the `clone-url`

theme:language-server.description: Start a Language Server Protocol server.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

dev-preview.name: dev-preview
dev-preview.description:
Use the dev preview version of theme check
Applies the typescript implementation of theme check to the theme

theme:list.description: Lists the themes in your store, along with their IDs and statuses.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

password.name: password
password.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

store.name: store
store.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

role.name: role
role.description: Only list themes with the given role.

name.name: name
name.description: Only list themes that contain the given name.

id.name: id
id.description: Only list theme with the given ID.

json.name: json
json.description: Output the theme list as JSON.

environment.name: environment
environment.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

theme:open.summary: Opens the preview of your remote theme.
theme:open.description:
Returns links that let you preview the specified theme. The following links are returned:

  - A link to the [editor](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/online-editor) for the theme in the Shopify admin.
  - A [preview link](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/themes/adding-themes?shpxid=cee12a89-AA22-4AD3-38C8-91C8FC0E1FB0#share-a-theme-preview-with-others) that you can share with other developers.

  If you don't specify a theme, then you're prompted to select the theme to open from the list of the themes in your store.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

password.name: password
password.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

editor.name: editor
editor.description: Open the theme editor for the specified theme in the browser.

theme.name: theme
theme.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

store.name: store
store.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

environment.name: environment
environment.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

theme:package.summary: Package your theme into a .zip file, ready to upload to the Online Store.
theme:package.description:
Packages your local theme files into a ZIP file that can be uploaded to Shopify.

  Only folders that match the [default Shopify theme folder structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#directory-structure) are included in the package.

  The ZIP file uses the name `theme_name-theme_version.zip`, based on parameters in your [settings_schema.json](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/architecture/config/settings-schema-json) file.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

path.name: path
path.description: The path to your theme directory.

theme:publish.summary: Set a remote theme as the live theme.
theme:publish.description:
Publishes an unpublished theme from your theme library.

If no theme ID is specified, then you're prompted to select the theme that you want to publish from the list of themes in your store.

You can run this command only in a directory that matches the [default Shopify theme folder structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#directory-structure).

If you want to publish your local theme, then you need to run `shopify theme push` first. You're asked to confirm that you want to publish the specified theme. You can skip this confirmation using the `--force` flag.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

password.name: password
password.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

theme.name: theme
theme.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

store.name: store
store.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

environment.name: environment
environment.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

theme:pull.summary: Download your remote theme files locally.
theme:pull.description:
Retrieves theme files from Shopify.

If no theme is specified, then you're prompted to select the theme to pull from the list of the themes in your store.

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: Increase the verbosity of the logs.

path.name: path
path.description: The path to your theme directory.

password.name: password
password.description: Password generated from the Theme Access app.

store.name: store
store.description: Store URL. It can be the store prefix (johns-apparel) or the full myshopify.com URL (johns-apparel.myshopify.com, https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com).

environment.name: environment
environment.description: The environment to apply to the current command.

theme.name: theme
theme.description: Theme ID or name of the remote theme.

development.name: development
development.description: Pull theme files from your remote development theme.

live.name: live
live.description: Pull theme files from your remote live theme.

nodelete.name: nodelete
nodelete.description: Runs the pull command without deleting local files.

only.name: only
only.description: Download only the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).

ignore.name: ignore
ignore.description: Skip downloading the specified files (Multiple flags allowed).

force.name: force
force.description: Proceed without confirmation, if current directory does not seem to be theme directory.

theme:push.summary: Uploads your local theme files to the connected store, overwriting the remote version if specified.
theme:push.description:
Uploads your local theme files to Shopify, overwriting the remote version if specified.

  If no theme is specified, then you're prompted to select the theme to overwrite from the list of the themes in your store.

  You can run this command only in a directory that matches the [default Shopify theme folder structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#directory-structure).

  This command returns the following information:

  - A link to the [editor](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/online-editor) for the theme in the Shopify admin.
  - A [preview link](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/themes/adding-themes?shpxid=cee12a89-AA22-4AD3-38C8-91C8FC0E1FB0#share-a-theme-preview-with-others) that you can share with others.

  If you use the `--json` flag, then theme information is returned in JSON format, which can be used as a machine-readable input for scripts or continuous integration.

  Sample output:

  ```json
  {
    "theme": {
      "id": 108267175958,
      "name": "MyTheme",
      "role": "unpublished",
      "shop": "mystore.myshopify.com",
      "editor_url": "https://mystore.myshopify.com/admin/themes/108267175958/editor",
      "preview_url": "https://mystore.myshopify.com/?preview_theme_id=108267175958"
    }
  }
  ```
theme:push.usage:
shopify theme push

shopify theme push --unpublished --json

theme:serve.summary: Uploads the current theme as a development theme to the connected store, then prints theme editor and preview URLs to your terminal. While running, changes will push to the store in real time.
theme:serve.description:
Uploads the current theme as the specified theme, or a [development theme](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#development-themes), to a store so you can preview it.

This command returns the following information:

- A link to your development theme at http://127.0.0.1:9292. This URL can hot reload local changes to CSS and sections, or refresh the entire page when a file changes, enabling you to preview changes in real time using the store's data.

  You can specify a different network interface and port using `--host` and `--port`.

- A link to the [editor](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/online-editor) for the theme in the Shopify admin.

- A [preview link](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/themes/adding-themes?shpxid=cee12a89-AA22-4AD3-38C8-91C8FC0E1FB0#share-a-theme-preview-with-others) that you can share with other developers.

If you already have a development theme for your current environment, then this command replaces the development theme with your local theme. You can override this using the `--theme-editor-sync` flag.

> Note: You can't preview checkout customizations using http://127.0.0.1:9292.

Development themes are deleted when you run `shopify auth logout`. If you need a preview link that can be used after you log out, then you should [share](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli/commands#share) your theme or [push](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli/commands#push) to an unpublished theme on your store.

You can run this command only in a directory that matches the [default Shopify theme folder structure](https://shopify.dev/docs/themes/tools/cli#directory-structure).

theme:share.summary: Creates a shareable, unpublished, and new theme on your theme library with a randomized name.
theme:share.description:
Uploads your theme as a new, unpublished theme in your theme library. The theme is given a randomized name.

  This command returns a [preview link](https://help.shopify.com/manual/online-store/themes/adding-themes?shpxid=cee12a89-AA22-4AD3-38C8-91C8FC0E1FB0#share-a-theme-preview-with-others) that you can share with others. Works like an alias to `shopify theme push -u -t=RANDOMIZED_NAME`.
